description: Install it via the terminal: sudo apt install lazarus-ide -it will work, this one says missing executable, and it complains about having multiple versions if it is still installed when you do it via the terminal, yet both are 2.2.0. This one also says 6.8 MB but it is 20x that with the dependencies it supposedly does not need. Otherwise you will be good.
summary: Can recommend, just not this version

description:
have to use the Terminal to install with:

and accept a blank/default configuration ....
